result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:43 AM 22CF124, 22CM51, 22CM52 
Defendant STUART L. LONG in court.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Eisenheim - DE cannot appear due to technical issues, maybe appointed to CF case. ADA Kaupie - DE previously refused to waive speedy trial demand, requests prompt dispo time limits be tolled pending appointment of counsel (same as what DE did in CM cases). Requests JT be removed from trial calendar.  Court - doesn't feel its appropriate w/o DE present.  Atty Eisenheim - will contact SPD to be appointed to CF case , then can discuss w/DE.
Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Eligible for SPD services

11:19 AM Cases 22CM51 & 52 and 22CF124.
Defendant STUART L. LONG appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights complied with.  Court advises DE he is eligible for Pub. Def., non found yet, questions DE if he wants to proceed w/o attorney or waive prompt disposition.  DE will to waive time limits and make payments toward Court appointed attorney.  ADA Kaupie - County normally does not appoint attorney if DE qualifies for Pub. Def.  State cannot communicate w/DE.
Court finds Pub. Def. is working diligently to find attorney and believes the Court will not find an attorney any faster.  Questions DE re: proceeding with trial.  ADA Kaupie argues DE must decide today as 7 witnesses (between 2 cases) are under subpoena.  Court agrees - explains again Attorney/prompt dispo options.
DE argues rights.  Court explains again.  ADA Kaupie requests court rule that DE is waiving prompt dispo as he is requesting attorney.  Federal constitution should trump statute.
Court finds constitutional right to attorney supersedes State statute for prompt dispo, tolls time limits until attorney is appointed.  Cancels Jury trials on May 26 & 27th.
Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:05 PM Defendant STUART L. LONG appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for State of Wisconsin. State presents motion to strike speedy trial. Court grants States's Motion. Speedy Trial demand was filed premature. Prompt Disposition remains in effect and trial has already been scheduled. Defendant brings up Nia Lee issues. State objects no written motion has been provided. Court requires Defendant to file a written motion regarding motion.

11:34 AM Defendant STUART L. LONG in court, in custody @ Kettle Moraine Correctional.  Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  STUART L. LONG appeared by video means.  Victim rights complied with to the extent possible.  Court reviews case, DE previously requested to be in person at prelim.  Court questions DE re: attorney.  DE states he has contacted Pub. Def., still waiting for attorney to be appointed.  Court advises DE of prelim, attorney rights & right to waive time limits.  ADA Kaupie - DE filed for prompt disposition and DA is under strict time limits.  Rule of DA office - Discovery is not forwarded until after preliminary hearing.  DE - having issues hearing proceedings, requests phone call to the court.  Court calls DE at Kettle Moraine.  
Previous discussions reviewed w/DE.  Court questions DE re: prelim/waiver of time limits.  DE waives time limits.  Court accepts waiver.  DE states he has never received copy of complaint.  ADA Kaupie - same charges as original case 20CF347.  Court advises ADA Kaupie to have complaint mailed to DE at Kettle Moraine.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
